title: Facebook will not remove deepfakes of Mark Zuckerberg, Kim Kardashian and others from Instagram
text: Facebook will not remove the faked videos featuring Mark Zuckerberg, Kim Kardashian and President Donald Trump from Instagram, the company said in a statement. Earlier today, Vice News reported on the existence of videos created by the artists Bill Posters and Daniel Howe and video and audio manipulation companies including CannyAI, Respeecher and Reflect.

title: U.S. antitrust chief says past enforcement could presage new probe of current digital giants
text: The top U.S. antitrust enforcer said on Tuesday that studying enforcement actions against Standard Oil and AT&T decades ago can help lay the groundwork for looking at possible anti-competitive behavior at today's tech giants such as Alphabet's Google and Facebook.

title: Facebook Roundup: Cryptocurrency, Political Ads, ECJ Ruling, Ownership, ITC Probe

title: WhatsApp is finally going after outside firms that are abusing its platform
text: WhatsApp has so far relied on past dealings with bad players within its platform to ramp up its efforts to curtail spam and other automated behavior. title: Top U.S. antitrust official details possible arguments against big tech
text: Assistant Attorney General Makan Delrahim laid out some possible antitrust arguments against big tech companies in a new speech. His office is reportedly overseeing possible investigations into Google parent company Alphabet and Apple.

title: Facebook will once again pay users to install an app that tracks their app usage
text: Facebook on Tuesday announced a new app is called Study that is designed to give Facebook data on what apps participants install, how much time they spend on those apps and more.

title: Kara Swisher: Code Con has a lot of big tech saying 'We're so sorry'
text: Recode co-founder Kara Swisher joins "Squawk Alley" to give her impressions of the first day of Code Con, where a lot of big tech companies are asking for regulation while assuring that bigger companies are better.

title: Facebook’s new Study app pays adults for data after teen scandal
text: Facebook shut down its Research and Onavo programs after TechCrunch exposed how the company paid teenagers for root access to their phones to gain market data on competitors. Now Facebook is relaunching its paid market research program, but this time with principles — namely transparency, fair compensation, and safety.

title: Facebook stock rises after MoffettNathanson upgrade

title: Changes to Facebook Graph Search leaves online investigators in a lurch
text: When Facebook Graph Search launched six years ago, it was meant to help users discover content across public posts on the platform. Since then, the feature stayed relatively low-profile for many users (its last major announcement was in 2014 when a mobile version was rolled out), but became a valuable tool for many online investigators […]
